column1: Pleural biopsy is a procedure to remove a sample of the tissue lining, the lungs, and the inside of the chest wall to check for disease or infection.
This test may be done in the hospital.
- Numbing drug (anesthetic) is injected through the skin and into the lining of the lungs and chest wall (pleural membrane).
Pleural biopsy can diagnose tuberculosis, cancer, and other diseases.
If this type of pleural biopsy is not enough to make a diagnosis, you may need a surgical biopsy of the pleura.
